I was impressed at the amount of cleaning and general maintenance that is done on a daily basis. The only items that I found missing were a hair dryer and work out facility. There is plenty of parking and I haven't seen or heard and loud people partying or talking late night. My kitchen had most everything you would need to cook with and it was relatively clean. My only complaint would be the recliner in my room. The vinyl was cracked and looked like a cat had used it as a scratching post. (see picture)

Summary: good for long term out of town folks, full size fridge, 2 stove  burners, Microwave, Sink, and 2 place servings. as well as pots, pans and a colander. On site laundry,and other local options - dry cleaners, restaurants, groceries, target, walmart, costco

Summary Heading: Last minute reservation, very nice room, elephant above me
Summary: Got in here for one night at the last minute.  Great rate considering the area.  Easy to find from highway.    Wonderful king bed with five comfy pillows.  Full size fridge in the kitchen, as well as stove, sink, etc.  Everything is nicely decorated and updated.  I don't think there was an exhaust fan in the bathroom.  At least not one that you can turn on.  Nice 32" (I think) LCD tv with plenty of channels.  AC unit worked well and had a fan option that I need to sleep.  The bad:  I was woke up at 5:30 am (planned on sleeping in til 9) by constant back and forth thumping noise from the guest(s) in the room above me.  Had to put in earplugs.  I will definitely stay here again if I am ever in that area again.

Summary: I have stayed at alot of hotels but this one by far was the best value for the money. The staff and management team were all very hepful and very friendly. The roons very spacious and clean. All and all a very nice safe and peaceful environment. I really enjoyed my stay and would recomend it to everyone.

Over all the room appeared clean until you tried to look out the windows.  I cleaned the top of the refrigerator with a disinfectant wipe and presented it to the front desk on check out.  It was black.   They did offer me a discount for my inconvenience.  I think this hotel is too close to the freeway to spend more than a day or two.  The pollution from the traffic permeates the air.  I left with a dry cough from the smog.  I would stay at the other location in Brea next time.

Although the night staff was curt with me, that my room's lock wasn't working much, the manager rectified the situation promptly the next morning. Jay was competent and kind in dealing with the situation. He did offer to give me a nonsmoking room the next day. He even helped with the refund of my stay with Expedia as I made accommodation plans elsewhere last night already. If I wasn't going to another hotel, I would stay here again. The guests

Summary: I reluctantly chose Anaheim Hills location because I thought it was going to be too far from all my job functions and in a sense it was.  But upon my check-in I was greeted so nicely by the front desk personnel particularly Robert the mananger and Luis the front desk attendant that I decided to stay and brave the distance.  The rooms are clean and modern and the free wifi is a added bonus along with the free coffee and granola bars and fruit for breakfast each morning.  Whenever I needed anything rather it be and extra pillow or silverware there would be no problem.  All in all my stay has felt very comfortable and homey, the staff at Extended Stay are awesome and I would definitely recommend the Anaheim Hills location to my co-workers and friends.

Upon pulling the comforter back I found dog hair covering one of the pillows and comforter. I asked for new bedding and got it. Later in the evening after a very tiring day my daughter was getting ready to go to bed and her bed was also covered in dog hair. The floor was filthy and its a good thing we had socks on because our feet were also covered in dog hair. At 12:30AM I called the front desk and requested new bedding once again. I was told by the person at the front desk if I didn't like the room I was welcome to come down and check out. I WAS VERY UPSET. In my son's room it smelled like urine even after leaving the windows

Full size refrigerator. Quite. Lots of professionals stay here, Good selections of restaurants nearby. Friendly staff.They serve continental breakfast ( Small Mufins, Coffee, Oatmeal, Apple and Oranges and etc.) The breakfast can be better or at least change the menu from day to day. And I will definitely tell my friends and families to stay there when they have meetings or vacations in Orange County. What a relief it is to deal with someone that's that easy to work with, and it's in California to boot!.

To drown it out required turning the AC fan way up which wasn't any better than the freeway noise.  I skipped the "Take and Go Breakfast".  It just didn't look very appealing.  The room was clean and adequate.  I wouldn't stay there again due to the close proximity to the freeway.

The location is very good (accessible to major highways) and the price can't be beat for the area, especially since the facility was recently renovated.  The "grab-n-go" breakfast consisted of coffee, oatmeal, pastries, granola bars, and whole fruit, which was sufficient for us given the price point. Please know that we would be thrilled to have you again as our guest should your travel needs bring you back to our area.  Once again, thanks for all of your very kind words.

Paying over $100 a night I expect shampoo and a pen. I was not expecting the level of the Hyatt summerfield or Marriott residence but felt I got the bare bones that I could tolerate and a good location for what we needed.

The beds were as comfortable as any hotel we have stayed in and we've stayed in many.
